marklogic.body: As a life-long hospital pharmacist who introduced the antibiotic order form to our hospital in 1982, it is surprising to learn that a large medical center hasn't been controlling for inappropriate antimicrobial use. HOWEVER, now that I have retired and am in a retail setting, it is clear to me where mandatory guidelines are REALLY needed.Â NoÂ one EVER gets a Cold anymore; everyone gets a SINUS INFECTION.Â It seems to be the rare practitioner who actually does a culture and forget about an antibiotic sensitivity test.Â More than narcotics and sedatives, antimicrobials are the the class in our armamentarium that really needs to be controlled!! We have entered an Era of community acquired resistant strains (C. diff,Â TB) from which we may not recover.Â And the widely used Â antimicrobial hand soaps, et. al., are contributing to further the problem
